definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: The rescue team moved on to the next collapsed building.
sentences.chinese: 營救隊進入到下一個倒塌的建築物。

sentences.english: The team leader emphasized the importance of the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 隊長強調了這次營救任務的重要性。

sentences.english: You want me to rescue captain thrace ?
sentences.chinese: 你想讓我去營救色雷斯上尉？

sentences.english: Rescue workers rushed to the site.
sentences.chinese: 營救人員趕往雪崩地點。

sentences.english: The well- drilled crew managed to rescue most of the passengers.
sentences.chinese: 訓練有素的機組人員設法營救出了大部分乘客。

sentences.english: Most of the aviators were brought to safety by Chinese rescuers.
sentences.chinese: 其中大多數飛行人員都被中國人營救，獲得安全。

sentences.english: Chen Tianfang see the situation is critical, led by the Cang wolf commandos launched rescue operations.
sentences.chinese: 陳天放眼見形勢危急，率領蒼狼突擊隊展開營救行動。

sentences.english: She is part of the Yosemite Search and Rescue team.
sentences.chinese: 她是約塞米蒂搜索營救隊的成員。

sentences.english: No mouth-to-mouth rescue breaths were given to them.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有被採取嘴對嘴呼吸營救。

sentences.english: On the economic front, China is paying the price for its rescue plan.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟戰線，中國正在爲此前的營救計劃付出代價。

sentences.english: The Chinese people have launched an all-out rescue and repair effort in disaster-stricken areas.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民已全力以赴展開一場災區營救和恢復工作。

sentences.english: Dolphins and porpoises are less vulnerable and will still be rescued.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，更爲堅強的海豚和鼠海豚是可以被營救的。

sentences.english: LeiZiFeng listen to rescue people on the spot small wangzhuang.
sentences.chinese: 雷子楓聽罷當場打算營救小王莊百姓。

sentences.english: Their plan embraced all aspects of the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 他們的計劃包含了營救的方方面面。

sentences.english: Rescue boat assisting No. 1 lifeboat standing clear of vessel now.
sentences.chinese: 營救船正在幫助1號救生艇讓開母船。

sentences.english: Rows of low houses were in ruin after the rush of flood.
sentences.chinese: 緊急救險隊利用它們從大火和洪水中營救遇難的人。

definition: to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to run away/to flee in disarray
to die in the line of duty
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
to meet violent death/to get killed
